structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.catch_line: Requirement for use of designation and display of license -- Prohibited activities -- Penalties.

text.section: An acupuncture practitioner shall use the designation "licensed acupuncturist" or "L.Ac." following his or her name in all advertisements, professional literature, and billings used in connection with his or her practice.
The license issued by the board shall be conspicuously displayed in the licensed acupuncture practitioner's place of business.

A person who is not licensed under KRS 311.671 to 311.686 shall not use any terms, words, abbreviations, letters, or insignia that indicate or imply that he or she is engaged in the practice of acupuncture.
Any person who violates this section shall be guilty of a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Amended 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 6, effective July 15, 2014. -- Created 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 249, sec. 6, effective July 12, 2006.
